channel.title: KeyListener
channel.description:
Okay well, I'm using robot class KeyListener for something, (not rs2 clients) when i compile it gets no errors but, when i hit the key it doesn't do anything. So i tryed to declare it like this
[code]implements, ActionListener, KeyListener[/code]
Now i get this error
[code]Warlock999.java:19: Warlock999 is not abstract and does not override abstract m thod keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent) in java.awt.event.KeyListener public class Warlock999 extends JFrame ^[/code]

item.title: KeyListener
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

Yes, got msn mine is warlock999@delta-core.net

Read full topic

item.title: KeyListener
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

So, is there a method called keyReleased(KeyEvent e) in your file called Warlock999.java?

If you want, you could email to me and I would fix…

Read full topic

item.title: KeyListener
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

I did that. I fixed the error by using implements KeyListener, and declaring applet.addKeyListener(this); But it still wont work…

Read full topic

item.title: KeyListener
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You need to implement all of the methods in the ActionListener and KeyListener interfaces.
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/awt/event/ActionListener.html
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/awt/event/KeyListener.html

N.B: You don’t need a , after implements, you only need one after every interface.

Read full topic
